bug.author: yanniszark
bug.summary: jupyter server: default image not working
bug.description:
How to reproduce: <denchmark-code>docker run -it --entrypoint=/bin/bash gcr.io/kubeflow-images-public/tensorflow-1.10.1-notebook-cpu:v0.4.0 # Run the jupyter server /opt/conda/bin/jupyter-notebook </denchmark-code>
Images tested:
tensorflow-1.10.0-notebook-cpu tensorflow-1.11.0-notebook-cpu tensorflow-1.12.0-notebook-cpu
The server fails with: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "/opt/conda/bin/jupyter-notebook", line 11, in <module> sys.exit(main()) File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/jupyter_core/application.py", line 266, in launch_instance return super(JupyterApp, cls).launch_instance(argv=argv, **kwargs) File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/traitlets/config/application.py", line 657, in launch_instance app.initialize(argv) File "<decorator-gen-7>", line 2, in initialize File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/traitlets/config/application.py", line 87, in catch_config_error return method(app, *args, **kwargs) File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/notebook/notebookapp.py", line 1602, in initialize self.init_webapp() File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/notebook/notebookapp.py", line 1381, in init_webapp self.http_server.listen(port, self.ip) File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tornado/tcpserver.py", line 143, in listen sockets = bind_sockets(port, address=address) File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tornado/netutil.py", line 168, in bind_sockets sock.bind(sockaddr) OSError: [Errno 99] Cannot assign requested address </denchmark-code>
The reason is because the /etc/hosts file is misconfigured and binding to localhost fails. More details here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/6193#issuecomment-466082026>ipython/ipython#6193 (comment)</denchmark-link>
A quick solution would be to include the argument --ip=127.0.0.1 /opt/conda/bin/jupyter-notebook --ip=127.0.0.1 Related Issue: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/3451>#3451</denchmark-link>
Ideally, we should change the default image to work without having to take extra steps. /cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kimwnasptd>@kimwnasptd</denchmark-link>
/priority p1

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> It looks like you are using the 0.4 docker image. What is the misconfiguration in /etc/hosts? Are we modifying /etc/hosts in our Docker images?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> I tried with the 3 latest images and all had the same error.
tensorflow-1.10.0-notebook-cpu tensorflow-1.11.0-notebook-cpu tensorflow-1.12.0-notebook-cpu
What is the misconfiguration in /etc/hosts?
We use localhost for both ipv4 and ipv6. This line is wrong: <denchmark-code>::1 localhost ip6-localhost ip6-loopback </denchmark-code>
It should be: <denchmark-code>::1 ip6-localhost ip6-loopback </denchmark-code>
More details here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/6193#issuecomment-466082026>ipython/ipython#6193 (comment)</denchmark-link>
Are we modifying /etc/hosts in our Docker images?
Where are we building these images?

cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link>
Update: The reason it's not working is because the jupyter-notebook images are wrong. Why are they wrong though? These images are specified in a ConfigMap, used by jupyter-web-app. That ConfigMap is out of date. This PR by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kimwnasptd>@kimwnasptd</denchmark-link> should fix it <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/pull/163>kubeflow/manifests#163</denchmark-link>
